channel.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
channel.description:
[center][IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/2yyuw3n.png[/img] [size=24pt][i][b]How to portforward with:[/b][/i][/size] [IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/souvdi.jpg[/img][/center] [left][size=28pt][font=impact]What you will be covering:[/font][/size][/left] [center] [font=comic sans ms][size=24pt]No-ip online setup[/size][/font] [font=comic sans ms][size=24pt]No-Ip Installing and hosting[/size][/font] [font=comic sans ms][size=24pt]Downloading uTorrent[/size][/font] [font=comic sans ms][size=24pt]Portforwarding with uTorrent[/size][/font][/center] [center]___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/center]
[IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/23wp8v4.png[/img] [center][font=verdana][size=18pt]Head to Http://no-ip.com[/size][/font] [IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/2s182tg.png[/img] [font=verdana][size=18pt]Sign Up an account [/size][/font] [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/33tqrut.png[/img] [font=verdana][size=18pt]Login to your account and create a [u][i][b]host[/b][/i][/u][/size][/font] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/988r43.png[/img][/center] [center][font=verdana][size=18pt]In the hostname fill in whatever you like, then to the right of that select the drop down arrow and choose either .no-ip.biz, .no-ip.org or .no-ip.info. Once you've chosen one of them you can hit the 'Create host' button in the bottom right. [/size][/font] [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/2u5tftl.png[/img][/center] _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
[IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/fu3xcg.png[/img] [center][font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt]Once your host is all good Hit the download client button on the left hand margin then choose your operating system, either; Linux, Mac or Microsoft Windows. After you've downloaded and installed the No-Ip client (DUC) run it and login![/size][/font] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/351uwwz.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/2hnotja.png[/img]
[center][font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt]Once you've done all that and logged in it should look a little like this. Just hit 'Select hosts'.[/size][/font] [IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/29ysf15.png[/img] [font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt]Then tick your host you made on the webpage and hit 'Save'.[/size][/font]
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/2vrvkvt.png[/img] [font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt]You're now hosting from no-ip if you're seeing this: [/size][/font] [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/2rzooyg.png[/img][/center] _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
[IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/2iksifs.png[/img] [font=andale mono][size=18pt][b]Go to [u]http://utorrent.com[/u][/b][/size][/font] [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/2a5028.png[/img] _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
[IMG]http://i50.tinypic.com/ix9tuo.png[/img] [font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt][b]Now it's time to do the actual portforwarding! Once installed it should look like this. Hit options->preferences then on the side links hit 'Connection'. Enter 43594 in the listening port and copy all the checked boxes below! [IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/24lu1qt.png[/img] Once you've got all that copied hit ok and run your server! there you have it, portforwarded via uTorrent! [/b][/size][/font] _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ [size=18pt]Hope you enjoyed this tutorial, thank you for taking the effort to read it and view this post. Means a lot if you leave either a comment or something informing me on weather this was helpful or not. Altogether I spent about 2 and a half hours putting this together so if you're still struggling then add my MSN at: [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/im3zq1.png[/img] And leave me a little message and ill get back to you as soon as I'm online! Thanks again, hope it's actually helped![/size] [left][IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/2je8wtl.png[/img][/left]

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
item.dc:creator: @Lirimoo Lirimoo
item.description:
@Lirimoo wrote:

uTorrent CAN portforward EVERY single router via allowing ‘uPnD Port’ in his Firewall and on his Gateway firewall.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
item.dc:creator: @RS_PS RS PS
item.description:
@RS_PS wrote:

Exactly uTorrent is terrible, If you do not know how to port-forward your router manually you have no hope in running a RSPS.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

uTorrent has to be the absolute worst way to port forward.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
item.dc:creator: @NieX NieX
item.description:
@NieX wrote:

If any of you need a hand portforwarding with anything just add my MSN I’ll do it for you and explain what I’m doing so you know for the future. Sorry, I was unaware so many routers didn’t accept this portforwarding method. Thanks though for your comments!

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:5, topic:451790”]Isn’t it because of UCP and TCP?(I know those aren’t the right acronyms)[/quote]Yes. I believe uTorrent bypasses the TCP only, and with certain routers that’s the only thing it needs. Others you need to bypass both.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Isn’t it because of UCP and TCP?(I know those aren’t the right acronyms)

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

No he’s right. It still denies access through different routers, when I had my server it wouldn’t let anyone connect with uTorrent, but I ended up portforwarding correctly, and it worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:2, topic:451790”]Ahem
You cannot portforward through Utorrent on most routers.[/quote]

What
uTorrent is for the people who can’t portforward. You don’t do anything to your router using this tutorial.
Also this tutorial has been explained multiple times.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Yes, this may be ‘easy’ (portforwarding is easy, too…) but its also incredibly shitty.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*

item.description:

item.title: Portforwarding your server the 'easy' way. *uTorrent*
item.dc:creator: @NieX NieX
item.description:
@NieX wrote:

[center]
[size=24pt]How to portforward with:[/size]
[/center]
[left][size=28pt][font=impact]What you will be covering:[/font][/size][/left]
[center]
[font=comic sans ms][size=24pt]No-ip online setup[/size][/font]
[font=comic sans ms][size=24pt]No-Ip Installing and hosting[/size][/font]
[font=comic sans ms][size=24pt]Downloading uTorrent[/size][/font]
[font=comic sans ms][size=24pt]Portforwarding with uTorrent[/size][/font][/center]
[center]___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________[/center]


[center][font=verdana][size=18pt]Head to Http://no-ip.com[/size][/font]

[font=verdana][size=18pt]Sign Up an account [/size][/font]

[font=verdana][size=18pt]Login to your account and create a host[/size][/font]
[/center]
[center][font=verdana][size=18pt]In the hostname fill in whatever you like, then to the right of that select the drop down arrow and choose either .no-ip.biz, .no-ip.org or .no-ip.info. Once you’ve chosen one of them you can hit the ‘Create host’ button in the bottom right. [/size][/font]
[/center]


[center][font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt]Once your host is all good Hit the download client button on the left hand margin then choose your operating system, either; Linux, Mac or Microsoft Windows. After you’ve downloaded and installed the No-Ip client (DUC) run it and login![/size][/font]

[center][font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt]Once you’ve done all that and logged in it should look a little like this. Just hit ‘Select hosts’.[/size][/font]

[font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt]Then tick your host you made on the webpage and hit ‘Save’.[/size][/font]


[font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt]You’re now hosting from no-ip if you’re seeing this: [/size][/font]
[/center]


[font=andale mono][size=18pt]Go to http://utorrent.com[/size][/font]


[font=trebuchet ms][size=24pt]Now it’s time to do the actual portforwarding! Once installed it should look like this. Hit options->preferences then on the side links hit ‘Connection’.
Enter 43594 in the listening port and copy all the checked boxes below!

Once you’ve got all that copied hit ok and run your server! there you have it, portforwarded via uTorrent! [/size][/font]

[size=18pt]Hope you enjoyed this tutorial, thank you for taking the effort to read it and view this post. Means a lot if you leave either a comment or something informing me on weather this was helpful or not. Altogether I spent about 2 and a half hours putting this together so if you’re still struggling then add my MSN at:

And leave me a little message and ill get back to you as soon as I’m online!
Thanks again, hope it’s actually helped![/size]
[left][/left]

Read full topic
